attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Drivers caught using a mobile phone whilst driving 6 penalty points. £1000 fine.
attributes.background: I have been an undertaker for many years. I have witnessed the aftermath and carnage whilst attending fatal crashes, where driver has been distracted by using mobile phone and lost control. The percentage of motorists using phones has risen!!! in the past 5 years. They are laughing at the law.
attributes.additional_details: I still remember attending a fatality where the driver had driven into back of lorry...his mobile phone still connected to the call.

attributes.action: Ban the production and selling of mink lashes!
attributes.background: Mink eyelashes are a growing trend,but these animals are put through a huge amount of pain just for there fur. The animals are kept in confind cages and factory's. None of this is humane. All for humans to look "nice" while these animals have no say if people can use there fur,and through pain.
attributes.additional_details: No use of animal fur is humane.

attributes.action: Regulate agency fees for tenants in the letting market to reduce excessive fees.
attributes.background: Letting agencies vary widely in the fees they charge from company to company and by region. It is often unclear exactly what you are paying for. High reference fees, checkout fees, and other charges, on top of depoisits, are unfair to tenants and make moving home unaffordable to many.

attributes.action: Brexit should NOT include free movement of people or contributions to EU funds.
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU and should not pay into it. They need to trade with us more than we need them.

attributes.action: DNA test and fingerprint needles left in the street, and prosecute the criminal
attributes.background: The public get stabbed by needles left in the street by drug users and have to wait 6 months to see If they caught HIV or Hepatitis A/B/C. Drug users who throw their needles on the street should be prosecuted with a minimum sentence. A simple test for DNA and fingerprinting will catch the criminal.
attributes.additional_details: The two techniques are used for very small crimes such as vehicle interference or trespassing. Sin bins and needle exchange has been provided for drug users as we understand their addiction therefore they is no excuse to put the public in danger of diseases. Children play on the street innocently because they are unaware of the risk of a needle which could change their life forever, smoking in the same car as a child is child abuse therefore how come giving a child a disease isn't abuse.

attributes.action: Stop the dismantling of the Corsellis brain bank at St. Bernard's Hospital.
attributes.background:
The Corsellis Brain bank took almost 50 years to build and was hugely important in research into illnesses such as epilepsy, CJD, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder and dementia.  
The West London Mental Health Trust is dismantling it for no purpose, as storing it would cost less than dismantling.
attributes.additional_details:
The WLMHT R&D site can be found here:
http://www.wlmht.nhs.uk/about-wlmht/research/contact-rd/ 

A detailed history of the collection can be found here:
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20817923 
 
The public announcement of its dismantling:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b06r5d0h 

It is stored at St. Bernard's Hospital under the authority of the West London Mental Health Trust.  After ten years of redevelopment the collection is now being dismantled, rendering it largely useless.

attributes.action: Waive the Police charges for the return of stolen vehicles to victims
attributes.background: Like many people I was recently the victim of motorcycle theft,  the police recently found the vehicle and told me it was subject to a £40 a day holding charge.  This is nothing but shameful profiteering on a victims loss from the Metroploitan Police a their policy should be changed.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a mother to deny contact with a child's father
attributes.background: Many mothers denying fathers having contact with there child for no reason what so ever! If the father is willing to step up and support there child, be there for them and care for them then why stop access?

attributes.action: To guarantee the rights of EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, the futures of EU nationals living in the UK and UK nationals living in EU countries are completely unknown. We demand that they are allowed to remain in the country of their choice.
attributes.additional_details: This petition does not seek to overturn the recent referendum result or request a second referendum.  It simply seeks to ensure that any Brexit deal guarantees the residency and employment rights of EU nationals living in Britain and Britons living in other EU countries which are not currently guaranteed. This has left many individuals and their families uncertain of their futures.

attributes.action: Evaluate health outcomes from a pilot of the new junior doctor contracts
attributes.background: Modern medical practice is based on critical reading of the evidence. The proposed changes to junior doctor contracts are based on an uncritical interpretation of research into weekend health outcomes, and are intended to lead to an untried extension of non-urgent procedures into weekends.
attributes.additional_details: “Our analysis of 2013-14 data suggests that around 11 000 more people die each year within 30 days of admission to hospital on Friday, Saturday, Sunday, or Monday compared with other days of the week (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday). It is not possible to ascertain the extent to which these excess deaths may be preventable; to assume that they are avoidable would be rash and misleading.” (Freemantle et al 2015, BMJ)

attributes.action:
Save HMS Hermes.
Rescue her from the scrap yard and bring her home.
attributes.background:
HMS Hermes served for over 30 years and was the flag ship during the Falklands conflict in 1982. She has been recently decommissioned by the indian navy and is now destined for the scrap yard.
She is a significant piece of the Royal Navy's history in the same class as HMS Victory and HMS Belfast.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Hermes could become a great floating museum and business and educational centre.

attributes.action: Create a Ministerial position for the Self Employed
attributes.background:
There are almost 4.8 million self employed people in the UK who have no direct representation in Government.  Whilst there is a Minister for Small Business (which is applauded), the needs of the self employed, in many cases, are very different to even small employers.
This needs to be addressed
attributes.additional_details:
Areas that need addressing include (but are not limited to):

- The need for a 'self employed bank account' - A simple transactional account
- Affordable financial services - Realistically priced income protection and medical cover should be introduced.
- The levelling of the playing field in terms of maternity and paternity
- Increased Pension provision - employees are being encouraged to enrolled into a Workplace Pension.  What is the sole trader equivalent?   

What else can you add?

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry to the conduct of both sides of the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: The way in which the recent campaigns were conducted was a disgrace with the public appearing to be either mislead or lied too. The facts and statements made by all sides should be considered and the enquiry should have the power to sanction those found to be either lying or misleading the public.

attributes.action: Bring baby boxes to Britain
attributes.background: BBC news Vanessa Barford (2016) wrote a brilliant article discussing the benefits to baby boxes in Finland. Since the boxes were introduced cot death dropped significantly in Finland and now Finland has the lowest mortality rates in the World.
attributes.additional_details: Barford (2016) stated that It's a tradition that dates back to the 1930s. Every new mother, regardless of background or income, gets a baby box from the government. The box contains a stash of supplies - bibs, bodysuits, nappies, a sleeping bag, outdoor gear, bathing products - as well as a small mattress. Putting the mattress in the bottom of the box creates the baby's first bed.

attributes.action: We call for a debate to discuss how more disabled people can be elected as MPs
attributes.background: People with disabilities are the least represented group in parliament yet they are disproportionately adversely affected by Government policies and decisions.  We believe it is time this and future governments make every effort to ensure people with disabilities are fairly represented in Parliament

attributes.action: EU citizens to not be allowed to vote in any Scottish independence referendum
attributes.background: EU citzens should not be allowed to vote in future Scottish Referendums it be for Scottish/Scottish living outside Scotland only.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for Group Strep B to be tested in every pregnancy
attributes.background: Group Strep B can be fatal to newborns and can be picked up during pregnancy. All it takes is a simple blood test (which are done in early stages anyway) or a swab. This needs to be made mandatory so it can be dealt with in the correct way during labour and afterbirth etc. Please help make it happen

attributes.action: Create a permanent and separate role of 'Minister for Mental Health'
attributes.background: I am writing this petition to ask the Secretary of State for Health Jeremy Hunt and Prime Minister David Cameron to create a 'Minister for Mental Health'. I know personally the devastating effects that mental health problems can have, both myself and within my family. It needs taking seriously.
attributes.additional_details: The current minister for 'Community and Social Care' Alistair Burt has numerous other areas of health to look after, which means that his full attention is not focused on this crucial area. There is still too little being done to reduce stigma, even with the government's promise to increase funding and awareness. I think a 'Minister for Mental Health' would have more control over the mental health budget and drastically improve care for our most vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Allow the british army to grow beards like the navy
attributes.background: It should be allowed for the british army to grow beards, the navy are allowed so why isnt the army? If you are in the british army and you are a sikh then you can grow a beard, this goes against equalitiy and diversity.
attributes.additional_details: The navy has regulations and guidelines for what classes as a beard, why can the army not have the same?

attributes.action: Debate the two letters from Professor A.C. Grayling and Phillip Kolvin QC.
attributes.background: I want action because I believe the arguments in these two letters are irrefutable.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.nchlondon.ac.uk/2016/07/01/professor-c-graylings-letter-650-mps-urging-parliament-not-support-motion-trigger-article-50-lisbon-treaty-1-july-2016/

attributes.action: Regulate car insurance companies over cost of car insurance
attributes.background: We the everyday motorists pay excessive amounts for car insurance, thre needs to be a look into their practice's and costing and needs to be capped or regulated
attributes.additional_details:
Car insurance for a 33yr old driver with no points , no accidents and 0 no claims on a 1.4 - £700 

Car insurance for same driver with 2 non fault accidents, 9 points for speeding when no accident involved and 1 years no claims on a 1.2 - £3500 

How can a insurance company expect to charge 5x for a smaller car when there has never been a cost to them .

attributes.action: Provide a clear and open way to reply to government responses to petitions
attributes.background: The petitions website was set up as a way for the electorate to influence policy and hold the government to account. While this is an excellent tool for improving communication between the public and the government, the responses are frequently dismissive with no recourse for the public to reply.
attributes.additional_details:
When responses are dismissive or ignore the core concerns of the people, it increases disillusionment and leads to disenfranchisement. In order to improve the power of this democratic tool to hold the government to account, there needs to be a clear, open and visible way for the public to reply to the government responses. 

Please provide a way for the public to reply and engage with government responses to improve the power of this tool.

attributes.action: Stop providing security for Tony Blair's Overseas commitments
attributes.background: Taxpayers are still footing Tony Blairs huge police protection bill. In some cases 12 Metropolitan Officers are involved at a cost to the tax payer of upto £16,000.00 per week.  This equates to an enormous amount of money over the past 6 years.
attributes.additional_details: His firm, Tony Blair Associates has made vast amounts of money over the past 6 years, and both his private and commercial work has taken him all over the world with round the clock protection, to which he should at least make a substantial contribution.

attributes.action: Hold a Parliamentary debate on Social Media Abuse
attributes.background: Social media abuse, including cyberbulling, trolling, sexting and grooming, are negatively affecting thousands of teenagers' lives on a daily basis, culminating in self harm, alcoholism, mental illness and suicide. We wish for the companies responsible to take additional steps to police their sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NSPCC, along with Barnados, have a huge amount of data highlighting the serious issues teenagers are dealing with when becoming victims of social media abuse. Not enough safeguards are deployed within these sites to deal with the amount of abuse aimed at our children which leave parents in total despair. The level of abuse affects our children in many ways with poor exam results, disengagement within society, drug and alcohol abuse, eating disorders and in some cases self harm and suicide.

attributes.action: Make welfare services VAT exempt
attributes.background: Why should families using organisations to help them with Dementia care, loneliness, respite etc pay VAT? Help us deal with the red tape that makes VAT applicable to a much needed elderly care service by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details: If an organisation is not a Charity, or it is 'out of scope' for CQC regulation, VAT is required to be paid by end users. Support in the home does have to involve personal care. Currently, families choosing services from a LTD or LLP company to help themselves or a loved one rather than state or charity provision are penalised with 20% VAT on vital care services.  Volunteer services and Charities can't cope with demand, so if you are willing to  pay for services that are not "personal care", we do not think VAT should have to be added. Seniors Helping Seniors® is an organisation that has evidence of great care outcomes for families and we are fighting the VAT charges. Refund will be passed back to every single family who has had to pay VAT to date.

attributes.action: To appoint an independent judicial body to review the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: There have been considerable concerns regarding the statements that were made during the EU referendum campaign & then their subsequent retraction. Our aim is to investigate & hopefully to establish why such things happened during the course of the campaign & to learn the lessons for the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the House of Commons appoints an independent judicial committee, comprised of senior Commonwealth judges, to review claimed deceptions in the campaigns leading up to the poll of 23 June 2016 on the UK’s membership of the European Union.

Given the advisory nature of the referendum, this would enable a review of the alleged deceptions and their impact on voters, with the findings reported to Parliament- the ultimate arbiter on when article 50 should be implemented.

attributes.action: FAIR TRADING-include the details of the leather source on the products labels.
attributes.background: Our campaign, aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Consumer Rights Reg.from Unfair Trading 2008 /1277, Reg. 6 (consumer right to be protected from unfair trading, where it is likely to cause the consumer to take a transactional decision he would not have taken otherwise).
attributes.additional_details: large portion of the leather available on the world market is exported, under omitted information such as “leather from an animal farmed for meat“. Some cultures, particularly Asian considers dogs and cats as “animals farmed for meat”. Our campaign aims to expose and end the cruelty within the leather industry. Based on existing legislation we therefore require that all retailers and traders include the details of the leather source on the products labels. We demand to know what it is we are buying

attributes.action: Remove international students numbers from the Immigration statistics
attributes.background: Britain is acquiring a poor reputation as a study destination for foreign students which will be exacerbated by Brexit. We need to stabilise this important contributor to universities finances and the wider economy, and immediately address fears about Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013-14 there were almost 67,500 international students attending London universities – making up 18% of the total student population in the capital, and 22% of the 310,000 international students across the UK. They contribute £1.32bn in fees; £1.36bn in subsistence spending, and £121m from their friends and families who visit them in the UK.

attributes.action: Class babies that have passed from 12 weeks on as stillbirth not miscarriage!
attributes.background: My daughter passed at 16 weeks gestation and i delivered her naturally at 20 weeks. She was perfect in everyway. Toes fingers everything all perfectly formed. She just wasnt alive. Shes down 'officially' as a miscarriage and i think the law on this needs changed!!
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately a lot of babies who have passed before 24 weeks and are 'categorized' as a miscarriage. This itself is a miscarriage of justice. Our children were here, we held them, we talked to them. They may have been born sleeping but they were still born!!

attributes.action: Reform the GCSE for child care level 3- so we do not need a C in GCSE
attributes.background: So other's who are capable of working with children but are not capable of gaining a GCSE'S at a C grade in English and Maths and still continue to qualify and be counted as a level 3.

attributes.action: Make energy drinks age restricted
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine and other ingredients that can lead to serious health issues. I, along with many other people, feel that all energy drinks should be sold under the age restriction law. I feel that the ingredients in energy drinks are not suitable for children younger than 16 years
attributes.additional_details:
Energy drinks are loaded with sugar and caffeine (sometimes more than twice the caffeine that's in a can of cola) so they’ll certainly give you a temporary energy jolt. However, the boost is short-lived and may be accompanied by other problems.
The caffeine in energy drinks can make you feel irritable and restless. It can increase your blood pressure, while the sugar can contribute to weight gain, especially if you don’t exercise regularly. http://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/tiredness-and-fatigue/Pages/energy-mythbuster.aspx

attributes.action: After The EU, Let The Public Decide Where £350 Million A Week Should Be Spent .
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum held on June 23rd 2016, the public made a democratic decision not to spend £350 million a week on the EU. 

As the public made the democratic decision not to spend it on the EU, the public should now democratically decide what £350 million per week should then be spent on.
attributes.additional_details:
As Agriculture received the largest amount back from the money spent on EU membership, the government must pledge that the higher percentage of the money saved from not being in the EU will be spent on agriculture. 

Every 4 years the public should then have a democratic say on where the remaining percentage should be spent, through official voting on a ballot, with boxes asking if the money should be spent; either: completely on the NHS, on public services, or education. This must be honoured.

attributes.action: Ban all religious practises from public outdoor areas.
attributes.background: Increasing trend of spreading religious practices, wordpship, prayers to parks, streets and in other public places directly discriminate non believing population and prevent peaceful coexistence of all religions with non believing population in the UK.

attributes.action: Class mysogynistic verbal harassment or physical approach as a hate crime in UK
attributes.background: Whether they are sexual or racial slurs, all verbal harassment and physical approaches are hate motivated. They are done to intimidate and cause upset/distress to the victim. Sexual harassment is still too often regarded as trivial and there is no current law that protects the public against it.
attributes.additional_details: Nottinghamshire police have started to record these instances of mysogynistic abuse as hate crimes, and this should be implimented nationwide. Whilst walking I was verbally harassed by a group of men in a car last night; the exact same thing happened to a friend. In this last week I have been yelled sexual comments at in the street by a man, and objectifyed so much on a busy train that I had to change carriage. Everyone has the right to live without being the target of sexual inappropriateness.

attributes.action: Children at a school nursery should get a reception class place at that school
attributes.background: not all children attending a school nursery meet criteria to get allocated a place within the reception class. I want to make a change and make it a criteria that if a child attendeds a school nursery they are offered a place within the reception class of that school.
attributes.additional_details: In the first year of attending nursery children become accustomed to the rules and routines of there new school, They get used to there surroundings and make lots of new friends. To then not get a place within the school along with all of there friends could set them back in terms of the confidence social skills and there education.

attributes.action: Include Fathers on Antenatal and Postnatal Mental Health NICE guidelines [CG192
attributes.background: Mark says “I’ve spoken to fathers with bipolar, schizophrenia, clinical depression, anxiety and other mental health illness who have no support plan in place at this crucial time. Fathers Suffer from Anxiety, Postnatal Depression and Trauma at childbirth too. Research says 1 in 10 fathers are (PND)
attributes.additional_details:
Clair Rees 1001 Critical Days Blog http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/clair-rees/fatherhood-a-generational-shift_b_10564612.html
Fathers Institute Perinatal Mental Health : http://www.fatherhoodinstitute.org/2010/fatherhood-institute-research-summary-fathers-and-postnatal-depression/
 Fathers and Childbirth Trauma:http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/why-the-trauma-of-childbirth-on-fathers-is-no-joke-8572222.html

attributes.action: We want lessons on Sexual Harassment and Rape in UK secondary School.
attributes.background: We want lessons in Sexual Harassment and Rape in PSHE in UK secondary schools made obligatory. We believe these lessons will educate and make young people more aware of the issue. We are campaigning for these lessons because some people don't understand the seriousness or definition of rape.

attributes.action: Make election manifestos a legal and binding contractual document
attributes.background: The voter bases their decision on who to vote for in local & general elections, on their promises made within election manifestos. We seek a law BEFORE the 2020 election, the make these manifestos, legally binding documents which must be adhered to within 12 months of election, or face prosecution
attributes.additional_details: If any government is voted in and does not fulfill their manifesto promises without good and legal reason within their first 12 months in office, they shall face prosecution under fraud law, and must immediately dissolve their government.

attributes.action: Reimburse travel costs for cancer sufferers and their families
attributes.background: Too many people are spending a lot of money getting to and from appointments with cancer specialists. They should be reimbursed for these appointments or have more cancer specialists at local hospitals
attributes.additional_details: Many people have to travel for specialist cancer care which costs a lot especially via public transport. I propose that these fares get reimbursed for cancer sufferers and their families OR the government puts more money into cancer and has specialised treatment available more locally across the country. One family is spending in excess of £200 a month to go backwards and forwards to London. At such a traumatic time, finances should not be adding to the worries.

attributes.action: Make inquests fair - Widen the legal aid scope for families attending inquests
attributes.background: The current system for providing legal representation for families at inquests is unfair and imbalanced. The current system allows public bodies legal representation, usually at public expense. Families are left without similar access & strict tests in exceptional cases for   obtaining legal aid.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: Stop private companies offering NHS services from using the NHS logo.
attributes.background:
Private companies such as Serco, Circle, Virgin and others deliver NHS services using the NHS name and logo.

The public does not want the NHS privatised and most people have no idea that they are being treated by the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS logo is a tried and trusted brand. If private companies give poor care while operating under the NHS brand, the NHS is likely to get the blame

It is important that users of healthcare services know who is providing the care they are getting.

attributes.action: UK time to ban animals in captivity in zoos and circuses 
attributes.background: Keeping animals in captivity and out of their natural habitat does not benefit them or their species in any way. Large animals like elephants and bears suffer the most as in the wild they roam for many miles daily. Species conservation is best done in the wild, without cages.
attributes.additional_details:
I took my son to a zoo and a circus when he was small & I felt always very sorry for the all the creatures there, I had no knowledge or background in species behavior, however I could still tell these animals were not at their natural best. 
Tigers pacing up and down relentlessly, little intelligent monkeys trying to communicate via the glass and elephants with very little space to live in. 
It all felt wrong then & now I know its wrong, its time to stop.

attributes.action: Make university free for all people.
attributes.background: All people should have the right to higher education, without having to worry about how they will pay off the £9000 per year (which is set to rise in 2017/18). This is wrong, because some people, of poorer backgrounds, will struggle to pay and therefore be put off university.

attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: Legalise euthanasia for terminally ill patients.
attributes.background: Patients with life limiting conditions should be entitled to the option of euthanasia.
attributes.additional_details: Painful and drawn out deaths could be avoided if this option was made available. We should have the same rights as our pets.

attributes.action: Discuss a possible free trade area with the rest of the Commonwealth of Nations.
attributes.background:
We, the British people, will vote on the 23rd of June whether we leave the EU or remain.
In order to silence fear-mongering, we need a plan.
How about the Commonwealth of Nations, our friends that we turned our backs on 41 years ago in favour of signing up, unknowingly, for an EU straightjacket.
attributes.additional_details:
A free trade area between the 53 states of the Commonwealth of Nations would be within the interests of the British economy.
13 of these countries are among the fastest growing in the world.
“The Commonwealth is the ideal platform for business and trade… I hope that India’s ties with the Commonwealth will move from strength to strength, and that the new paradigm will only mean greater warmth, greater co-operation.” Kamal Nath, Former Indian Development Minister
The Commonwealth is the future.
